arts.ttl: Frank Lampard closing in on transfer targets to 'thicken out' his injury-hit Coventry City squad
arts.sum: Asked if he’s any closer to securing the services of fresh talent in the current transfer window, Lampard said: “We are looking to see if we can help the squad. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: John Eustace provides Blackburn Rovers transfer update as problems pile up
arts.sum: Blackburn Rovers lost 2-0 to Coventry City and are without several key players

arts.ttl: What Frank Lampard 'didn't like' about Coventry City's away win at Blackburn Rovers
arts.sum: Frank Lampard was more than happy with his Coventry City players’ win from a performance that he said was far from their best, particularly in a drab first half at fifth placed Blackburn Rovers. Chances were few and far between in the first half with only one attempt and Simms’ goal coming as the first on target in the 41st minute while Oliver Dovin made two important saves to keep City in the game.

arts.ttl: Sondre Tronstad latest as Blackburn Rovers suffer more injury concerns
arts.sum: John Eustace gave an update on the injury situations after the 2-0 defeat against Coventry City

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers player ratings as Makhtar Gueye stands out from the rest
arts.sum: Marks out of ten after Blackburn Rovers were beaten by Coventry City

arts.ttl: Predictable goal-scorer exposes Blackburn Rovers' problems in Coventry defeat
arts.sum: Blackburn Rovers were beaten 2-0 by Coventry City at Ewood Park

arts.ttl: Lampard's Coventry ease to win at Blackburn
arts.sum: Ellis Simms and Brandon Thomas-Asante scored either side of the break as Frank Lampard's Coventry triumphed 2-0 at Blackburn to make it back-to-back Championship wins.

arts.ttl: Coventry ease to victory at Blackburn to edge further clear of danger
Coventry City player ratings v Blackburn as Dovin shines amid Simms and Thomas-Asante goals - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Coventry then doubled their lead in the third minute into the second half following an outstanding five man move which all started when Liam Kitching drove upfield and laid the ball off to Victor Torp who hit a sublime first time pass out to Milan van Ewijk. Goals either side of the break from Ellis Simms and Brandon Thomas-Asante put Coventry City on course for only their third Championship victory on the road this season as they beat fifth placed Blackburn Rovers.
